title: Aleksandar Ranković (footballer)
text:
Aleksandar Ranković (<a href="Serbian%20Cyrillic%20alphabet">Serbian Cyrillic</a>: Александар Ранковић; born 31 August 1978) is a <a href="Serbia">Serbia</a>n <a href="association%20football">football</a> manager and former player. He is the head coach of <a href="ADO%20Den%20Haag">ADO Den Haag</a> of the Dutch <a href="Eredivisie">Eredivisie</a>. As a player, Ranković played the entirety of his professional career in the Netherlands and his native Serbia.
Club career.
Ranković started his professional career with <a href="FK%20Rad">FK Rad</a>, making his first appearances in 1997, at the age of 19. In 2002, <a href="Netherlands">Dutch</a> side <a href="SBV%20Vitesse">SBV Vitesse</a> showed interest for the player and brought him into the <a href="Eredivisie">Eredivisie</a>, where he played as a first team regular for three seasons. In 2005, he moved to fellow Eredivisie participants <a href="ADO%20Den%20Haag">ADO Den Haag</a> where he became one of their key players.
Ranković hit the news in January 2007, when he was sent off in a 3–1 defeat to <a href="AZ%20%28football%20club%29">AZ</a>, match in which he also scored a goal. The incident took place after the referee Kevin Blom awarded a penalty to AZ, and Ranković pushed Blom whilst shouting "When I see you in the city, I'll kill you". Ranković received a five match ban for the death threats. He later apologized for the incident.
On 22 June 2011, Ranković signed a one-year deal with <a href="FK%20Partizan">FK Partizan</a>.
Coaching career.
On 15 May 2020, Ranković was announced as the new head coach of <a href="ADO%20Den%20Haag">ADO Den Haag</a> until 2022.
